CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 26, 1952, pg. 1, reads: "B'nai B'rith Art Contest - Prize winners in annual B'nai B'rith Art Contest, sponsored by the groups Women's Council in the Pittsburgh Public Schools were announced at the Board of Education's Administration Building last Thursday and awards presented to the talented students on Monday. The winning illustrations on the theme: "Democracy in Action" were selected for both art skill and understanding of the meaning of American Democracy.  Raymond Saunders 11-A Schenley High student, shown with his mother and his prize winning illustration in the far left photo won the first prize of $20.  His mother, Mrs. Marie Saunders is shown admiring his work.  Left center photo: Miss Janie Norton and Phyllis Wagner, 12-B Allderdice High School student, are shown with her work which won the second prize of $15.  Right center photo: Dr. and Mrs. Jesse Quatse are shown admiring the work of their daughter, Laverne Quatse, 12-A Schenley High student who won the third prize of $10.  In the far right photo are shown the judges of the contest.  Left to right: Roger W. Anliker, assistant professor of painting at Carnegie Tech; Mrs. Ben Feinberg, past president of the B'nai B'rith Womens Council, and S. Lakowski of the Simboli School of Art."
TitMainTitle: Janie Norton and Phyllis Wagner standing next to Norton's painting depicting classroom scene at B'nai B'rith Art Contest
